doc.previous: Author Marjorie Heins, an attorney with a focus on civil liberties,[1] received a Bachelor of Arts degree from Cornell University in 1967.[1]
doc.after: She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard Law School, receiving a juris doctor degree in 1978.[1] At the time of the book's publication, Heins was director of the Free Expression Policy Project at the National Coalition Against Censorship.[2][3]
